entry.title: CX80 to host exclusive stand at EOC in Hungary
entry.summary: At the European Orienteering Championships and World Cup Round 3 in Hungary, our partner CX80 will have its own stand. This event will offer an opportunity for attendees to engage with one of the leading brands in the industry and to try out a range of high-quality technical products designed for daily life and for […]

entry.title: Aylott Foundation supports junior MTBO
entry.summary: Orienteering Australia are pleased to announce that the Nigel Aylott Memorial Sports Foundation (NAMSF) has provided ongoing funding to support junior MTBO competitors who have been selected to represent Australia at world championships. Aylott Foundation supports junior MTBO first appeared on Orienteering Australia.

entry.title: Warm and tough EOC to begin on Friday
entry.summary: The world’s best orienteers return to the forest, when the 2024 European Orienteering Championships begin in Hungary on Friday. Exactly one month after the World Orienteering Championships ended with an exhilarating Knock-Out Sprint on the hard surfaces of Edinburgh, the EOC kicks off with the middle distance qualification in the challenging, hilly terrain of central […]

entry.title: Team Ireland for Senior Home International 2024
entry.summary: The SHI Selectors are delighted to announce Team Ireland for the Senior Home International 2024. The competition will be held in Scotland, on the 7th & 8th of September. We congratulate the team on their selection, and wish the team the very best of luck with the competition. entry.title: Home International Season
entry.summary: The 2024 Home International Season is almost upon us with the Seniors first to compete in Scotland on 7-8 September. The Ireland team has been announced as: W20: Ellie Simpson, Emily Rowe, Eve Buckley. Reserve: TBC M20: Daire O’Brien, Fionn O’Callaghan, Tivon Tyner. Reserve: Josh Hoare W21: Aine McCann, Aoife McCavana, Aoife O’Sullivan, Éadaoin McCavana, Emer... The post Home International Season appeared first on NI Orienteering Association.

entry.title: VEGAS VINDALOO MTBO WEEKEND – ROTORUA – 21-22 SEPTEMBER 2024
entry.summary: The Vegas Vindaloo MTBO Weekend is back for 2024! One weekend, three events – Sprint, Long and Rogaine. Tempt your tastebuds by giving MTB orienteering a go! And great build up for anyone going to Australian MTBO Champs at end of October. Events are targeted at individuals, but welcome to compete as team (particularly the rogaine). entry.title: WMOC Long: 12 golds for Finland on final day
entry.summary: World Masters Orienteering Championships 2024 came to an end on Friday, when the Long distance concluded the WMOC-week in Finland. The athletes competed west of Turku in the Finnish archipelagoes in relatively open and rocky terrain. That suited the home nation well, as Finland was the most successful nation with 12 golds on Friday. Sweden […]

entry.title: World Masters MTBO Championships well underway in Denmark
entry.summary: More than 400 masters athletes are racing for World Masters MTBO titles at WMMTBOC in Viborg, Denmark this week. Four races: Mass start, Middle, Sprint and Long will take the athletes to some of the finest MTBO terrains in Jutland in western Denmark, among them Ebeltoft and Undallslund plantations, which were also used for the […]

entry.title: WUOC 2024 Recap and Results
entry.summary: Competing in Bankso, Bulgaria this year from 1-5 August, WUOC 2024 saw 12 Australian athletes fight hard in all events. WUOC 2024 Recap and Results first appeared on Orienteering Australia.

entry.title: WMOC Middle: Demanding terrain for Wednesday’s final
entry.summary: The athletes at the World Masters Orienteering Championships in Finland were met with challenging courses at the middle distance final on Wednesday. The more than 3,700 participants were just like at Tuesday’s forest qualification in the forests at Sauvo east of the host city Turku. Today’s terrain was full of details with very few paths […]

entry.title: North America crowns its champions this week in Ontario
entry.summary: The biennial North American Orienteering Championships start this Tuesday in Canada’s Ontario region and feature five championship races over the coming days. The first race is the individual sprint, then there’s a Sprint Relay on Wednesday before Thursday’s Knock-Out Sprint concludes the sprint races, all taking place in the city of Kingston, Ontario. Here the […]

entry.title: WMOC: Challenging sprint final in Turku
entry.summary: More than 3,200 masters athletes took part when the first final at the World Masters Orienteering Championships in Finland was run on Sunday. The sprint final took place in central Turku, the host of city the championships, which featured challenging courses with plenty of demanding short leg in a mix of parkland and hard surfaces […]

entry.title: WMOC to start in Finland with 4000+ participants
entry.summary: The 2024 World Masters Orienteering Championships have attracted more than 4,200 competitors to the south-west corner of Finland, where the competitions begin on Saturday with the sprint qualification race. 42 nations are represented at the championships, where world masters champions will be crowned in 25 classes from W/M 35 up to W95 and M90. entry.title: 2024 WOC | Edinburgh, Scotland | 12-16 July

WOC2022 was thought of as a stage on the way to that goal, although visa and covid problems rather upset the apple cart for that one. entry.title: JWOC | Pilsen, Czechia | 1-6 July
entry.summary: What a successful JWOC. The anticipation was high beforehand, and Zefa Fa’avae winning 2nd place in the long event is our best ever placing in the forest terrain for the Junior World Orienteering Championships long event. It follows in the footsteps of Matt Ogden’s golden medal win in the forest terrain for the middle event […] JWOC | Pilsen, Czechia | 1-6 July first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Invitation to the Sunshine State champs
entry.summary: New Zealanders thinking of coming to the Australian Championships being held at Armidale on the Northern Tablelands of New South Wales at the end of September might be interested in also attending the Queensland Orienteering Championships being held on the preceding weekend, 21/22 September.This two day event will be held just north of Stanthorpe on […] Invitation to the Sunshine State champs first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Oceania 2025 | Embargoes & first Bulletin
entry.summary: Four days of Oceania racing, a warm-up weekend and two training days are being prepared by orienteering clubs of the lower North Island. The warm-up events are on 18-19 January in Taranaki, followed by training maps in the lead-up to the four official Oceania 2025 races from 24-27 January. Oceania 2025 is supported and sanctioned by both Orienteering […] Oceania 2025 | Embargoes & first Bulletin first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Taitonga Southern Champs | Waikaia | 7-8 February 2025
entry.summary: Waikaia! How fondly we all remember events from, it seems, the very distant past! entry.title: Nationals 2025 | 18-21 April 2025
entry.summary: Explore the diverse Canterbury region of the South Island for Easter 2025. All the New Zealand nationals championship events will be within 90 minutes of Christchurch International Airport. Join us for challenging orienteering across a variety of terrain with newly mapped areas. The nationals website is undergoing small updates but in the meantime we also have brief […] Nationals 2025 | 18-21 April 2025 first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Canterbury Schools & SISS | 7 – 8 September
entry.summary: After JWOCC & NZSSOC, we are excited to continue events for youth sport. The South Island Secondary Schools Championships (SISS) and the Canterbury Orienteering School festival weekend have combined for a two-day competition. This has something for everyone. You can choose to orienteer on your own in a competitive grade if you have orienteering experience; or […] Canterbury Schools & SISS | 7 – 8 September first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Taupō School’s Orienteering | Half-yearly report
entry.summary: A series of introductory orienteering sessions held mainly within schools has just been completed over term 2 for 13 schools in Taupo and surrounding areas. This is a good increase from 8 schools who took part in these sessions in 2023. Two of the new schools were Kura for which we made school maps with […] Taupō School’s Orienteering | Half-yearly report first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Controller’s clinic | Nelson | 7-8 September
entry.summary: The course will be of interest to course planners, controllers and organisers who wish to update their skill-set, for all events from club events to national championships. It is a prerequisite to becoming an ONZ A or B grade Controller. Topics include the Function and tasks of the Controller; Event Organisation; Technical detail about the map, control sites and courses; SportIdent and timing; Complaints, […] Controller’s clinic | Nelson | 7-8 September first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: King’s Birthday Weekend | A cheque finish!
entry.summary: Nelson Orienteering Club’s King’s Birthday Weekend event in Golden Bay was a roaring success, providing competitors from around the country and Australia with Challenging courses – and even the weather played its part. entry.title: Trewin on IOF Event Supervisory Board | 2024-26

entry.title: Sport NZ |Diversity, Equity & Inclusion survey results
entry.summary: The Sport NZ 2024 DEI Sector Workforce Survey report is out now. This report captures insights from 109 organisations and 1,425 people across the sector providing insights on the make-up and experiences of board members and employees working in the play, active recreation and sport. The 2024 reports shows that meaningful progress has been made across the sector […] Sport NZ |Diversity, Equity & Inclusion survey results first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: WOC 2024 Knock-Out Sprint: Analysis, Maps and Results
entry.summary: Tove Alexandersson (Sweden) and Riccardo Rancan (Switzerland) won the World Orienteering Championships (WOC) Knock-Out Sprint – the last race of the championships. Silver and bronze went to Karolin Ohlsson (Sweden) and Simona Aebersold (Switzerland) in the women’s class, and Jørgen Baklid (Norway) and Jonatan Gustafsson (Sweden) in the men’s class. While the men’s race was a ...

entry.title: Park Street Update: Events July 23-29
WOC: Rancan and Alexandersson KO Sprint Champions
entry.summary: Riccardo Rancan (SUI) and Tove Alexandersson (SWE) claimed the World Championship titles in Knock-Out Sprint Tuesday afternoon. Central Edinburgh welcomed the 72 athletes back from the qualification in the morning with heavy showers for the quarter finals before it eventually stopped raining for the semi finals later in the afternoon. Once again the centre of […]
